statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Winthrop 63, Charleston Southern 49
article.story: ROCK HILL, S.C. (AP) -- Winthrop won at least a share of its sixth Big South Conference regular season title in seven years with a 63-49 win over Charleston Southern on Tuesday night. The Eagles (19-10, 10-3) can win the league title outright in coach Randy Peele's first season with a victory Saturday over UNC Asheville, or if the Bulldogs lose to Coastal Carolina on Wednesday night. The top seed plays at home throughout the Big South tournament. The Buccaneers (9-19, 3-10) will finish in last place in the Big South for the second straight season. Charleston Southern led 7-3 two minutes into the game, but Winthrop scored the next 10 points and never trailed again. The Eagles' lead was cut to 41-38 with 13 minutes left, but Winthrop went on an 18-4 run over the next nine minutes to put the game away. The Eagles have beaten Charleston Southern 14 straight times. Michael Jenkins scored 14 points to lead Winthrop, while Mantoris Robinson added 13 points and eight rebounds. Chris Moore led the Buccaneers with 16 points, while Omar Carter added 12 points and eight rebounds.
